document_data.name: Geezer Loryss
document_data.mainbody:
'''Geezer Loryss''' was a vegetable vendor in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''My poor, sweet vegetables, They deserved better...''|Geezer Loryss}}
document_data.Description: Geezer was an aging [[human]] man with graying hair.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Geezer ran a vegetable stall and was affected by the city's new draconian laws that confiscated most farm animals and produce entering the city in order to fight encroaching famine, according to the [[Flaming Fist]]s. At one point during that tumultuous year, Geezer managed to get a shipment of [[cabbage]]s into Baldur's Gate but the card ended up upturned, scattering the vegetables. The old man lamented his beloved vegetables' fate and his empty stall.
